abstract: Legendary American hockey player Wayne Gretzky attributes decline in NHL scoring to lack of creativity on part of coaches and players; teams are averaging 2.71 goals apiece per game, lowest average since so-called dead puck era of 1995 to 2004, when interference tactics and neutral zone trap were rampant.
lead_paragraph: The points scored by league leaders reflect how far removed hockey is from its offensive heyday, when Gretzky roamed the ice.

headline.print_headline: Gretzky Has a Few Points to Make
headline.main: Wayne Gretzky Has a Few Points to Make About a Decline in Scoring and Creativity

snippet: The points scored by league leaders reflect how far removed hockey is from its offensive heyday, when Gretzky roamed the ice....
